chunks.en: Has anyone had conflicts with their father-in-law?

My father-in-law is a primary school teacher. He came to spend the Lunar New Year with us this year, bringing a lot of sausages and cured meat from his home. After arriving, he also deep-fried a lot of crispy pork before the New Year, all of which was put in the refrigerator. Plus, he loves to cook, so we've been eating mostly these meats every day.

On Lunar New Year's Eve, we had lunch outside. In addition to ordering a lot of meat dishes, we also ordered a lettuce salad. My father-in-law insisted on ordering another 'green vegetable' dish, because Lunar New Year's Eve dinner must have 'green vegetables,' and lettuce doesn't count because it's not a cruciferous vegetable. In the end, a lot was left over, so we packed it up and took it home, saying 'May there be surpluses every year.'

On the first day of the Lunar New Year, we went out to play together. There were stalls at the scenic spot providing paper, brushes, and ink for tourists to write the character ç¦ (fÃº, fortune). My father-in-law went up and wrote a few and brought them back. Later, I found out that he had written and brought back a couplet that said, '...Family harmony brings prosperity... Family decline for three generations' to paste at home. I felt uncomfortable pasting this on the first day of the Lunar New Year, but I didn't say anything.

This morning, my wife and I took him to visit relatives. On the way, he said, 'Tonight at 9 PM is the Beginning of Spring, so we need to 'hide from spring.' Don't go out at that time, don't talk, and turn off your cell phones.' I didn't feel good about it, but I didn't say anything at the time.

After returning home, my wife and I expressed our concerns about eating too many processed meat products and leftovers, as well as the fact that 'hiding from spring' is a feudal superstition, and hoped that she could remind her father.

As a result, my wife was very angry and felt that I was picking on her dad. My emotions flared up at that time, so she simply posted what I said in our shared group, listing all my faults, and we had another argument that night.
Dear V2EX users, have you ever had conflicts with your father-in-law, and how did you handle them? Thanks!
Your wife has a problem with how she handles things. She should be mediating the conflict, not exacerbating it.
Also, let the older people do what they like to do. They won't listen anyway. Unless it involves major issues, just go along with it.
Your wife has low EQ, just like mine...
Haha. Last year, we had some financial pressure, and my wife kindly introduced her cousin to me, saying that he would take us to make some money and help us get through the difficulties.

Her cousin started a factory, talking about a photovoltaic project, and borrowed 20 million from the bank with his partners. He claimed that once the factory was built, it could be immediately sold to the government, at least quadrupling the investment, implying that it was a white-glove project for government insiders and that all the connections had been taken care of...
He said that I could participate and make a lot of money in return.
When I heard about this kind of project, I thought it was stupid. The logic didn't even make sense. They already got 40 million from the bank?
If they want to lead me to make money, and I really want to invest, how much should I invest?
If they're so good, if they really want to help us, they should lend us 200,000 first, saying that we don't need to rush to pay it back, and we can pay it back when we have spare money.

But out of politeness, I was still quite polite and chatted with her cousin for a long time, expressing my gratitude that my cousin thought of us and took us to make money during our difficult times...
Then I pretended to ask how much money I would need to invest?
Her cousin meant to invest 2 million first... Hahaha...
I was originally thinking of investing 20,000 as tuition to learn about the inside information, seeing that her cousin was so enthusiastic.
As a result, he came up to me and said 2 million, which is too kind of him, haha.
Then I said that I just bought a house and had less than 300,000 in cash left...
Then her cousin began to earnestly teach me that successful people must learn to use rules to leverage, meaning that I could first find a way to borrow 2 million, and in less than a year...

Then I pretended to chat and said that I could get up to 500,000, but how can I guarantee a steady profit without loss, and should we write a contract? Her cousin began to say that there can't be too many shareholders, it will be difficult to operate at that time, you can trust me, your cousin, blah blah... Forget it... I'm too lazy to talk about the rest...

Mainly then I expressed my doubts about her cousin's character to my wife, and by the way, I checked all the information about her cousin's company and told my wife that her cousin's companies were shell companies, quite unreliable, simply using relatives to harvestéŸ­èœ (jÇucÃ i, chives, metaphor for being taken advantage of), and this sickle is really bloody...
In turn, my wife actually told her cousin everything I thought of him (just when I was arguing with her at that time)...
I was completely speechless and knelt down to my wife's EQ, not that I cared about her brother's feelings.
I certainly don't care, I won't have any contact with people like her brother, and I don't want to have any contact with them.
Originally, we were all relatives, and I thought that there might be some feigned merrymaking during festivals, but now it's good, we've completely broken off all ties...
In addition, I have had several conflicts with my mother-in-law, and I am too lazy to talk about the details. I still stick to my own views.
Looking at it, you're just nitpicking. As a man, be more open-minded. He's an elder and your wife's father. You may not be close, but you can't be impolite!

Sending chat content to the group for both parents to see, I get dizzy just imagining that scene. If your wife has always been this nt (don't blame me for speaking frankly, that's what I think), if you don't have children, I suggest getting a divorce early.

chunks.en: The conflict in your family is not actually about your father-in-law. To put it bluntly, there is a gap between the cognitive and living habits of two generations, which is very normal. You don't live together. Just bear it for these few days of the New Year. Your wife is the one who exacerbates the conflict.

Don't pretend to be a good person either. What is there to say about such trivial things? You posted the post. We don't know what you said to your wife that made her so unhappy. Perhaps it was that you belittled your father-in-law in your words.
One has low EQ, the other has low IQ, amazing.
A one-sentence summary: The fundamental reason you are being told what to do is that in the eyes of others, you are a weakling. Look for the reasons within yourself more.
If you are more awesome year by year, I don't believe your father-in-law and wife would dare to challenge you.
This is the real reason. The others are not important.
If you were awesome from the beginning, you wouldn't have such a wife and such a father-in-law.

chunks.en: @flowerfly These are just personal subjective suggestions: As a man, I can understand your father-in-law, it's actually all a soft landing to resolve the conflict. A normal old father doesn't dote on his daughter, but your father-in-law has already compromised by coming to your home and constantly cueing you. You still feel like you're losing face. Actually, according to their generation's thinking, they have already given you a way out. Respect your father-in-law, respect your wife, and even more so, respect your responsibility as a man to build a family. What your wife did is not what they say, like your wife went back to accuse and expose you. That's not right. Actually, in the long run, what your wife did is right. If you're bullied, shouldn't you look for your father? It would be stupid not to. What a woman wants is a reliance. You can say that your wife can't stand being wronged and has the temper of a young lady. But you need to solve it, to guide it. This is your responsibility as a man. You have sparked conflict. If you say that you want everyone to be mature, not to disturb each other, and have a sense of boundaries, then why did your wife marry you? To have one less mouth to feed? If you want the family to continue, then admit your mistake, otherwise it will be difficult to end it later. At the very least, go over in the middle of the night, or send a message and visit to explain tomorrow morning... Those in the comments section who say that OP's wife has problems, should they get married first? Do you want OP to be divorced and separated from his wife? The fifteenth day of the first lunar month hasn't even passed yet.
@cndns I would definitely tear down that couplet immediately: <...Family harmony brings prosperity... Family decline for three generations>.
Pasting couplets at someone else's house, what kind of thick skin do you need to do that?
I don't think there's anything wrong with OP. What great principles are the tortoises in the comments section trying to elevate this to?
Point 1, superstition, forcing extra dishes; Point 2, dogshit couplet, dogs write better than him; Point 3, superstition.
The best way to solve this is to let it go, take the initiative to avoid it, and don't talk if you can avoid it.
But you don't think OP's views are abnormal, do you?
Are you the only ones in China?
Are you the only ones who understand social interaction?

OP's thoughts are thoughts that every normal person would have, and as adults, we sometimes find it 'difficult' to tell those normal thoughts to stupid people. Not saying it is called good EQ, but saying it is not a big deal to me. The earth doesn't revolve around you, so why can't I be happy first in everything?
Besides, it was said privately to his wife.

In my opinion, the wife's EQ is even more insufficient. She doesn't treat her husband as her own person. I'll say something OP doesn't want to hear, I hope you don't mind, I'm just speaking my mind. Your wife is the most disgusting.
I suggest that OP can relax a bit later, let it do whatever it likes, just pretend you don't see it, and find something fun to do for yourself, it's very cool.

After reading it, I found that there are quite a few turtle men on v2. OP has opinions about his father-in-law, but he didn't argue with his father-in-law face to face, and just privately told his wife to remind him.
His wife can disagree, but posting it directly in the group is disgusting, and he even has to apologize.
Damn it, on the first day of the new year, he stole 2 of my blues, I was so angry that I didn't even want to eat with himğŸ˜¡
@flowerfly Don't treat being straightforward as an advantage or an excuse, you're definitely not straightforward with everyone.
Friend, your father-in-law is not a big problem, but your wife is a big problem.
@ugpu #28 Old buddy, I'm not asking OP to immediately become awesome like a rocket, right?
The thing is, as long as his father-in-law sees that he is stronger year by year, he will naturally stop teaching him this and that.
What he needs to do now is to make some progress every year, earn 30,000 to 50,000 more than the year before, and naturally his father-in-law and wife will listen to him.
The point is that he's not good enough now and is always blaming external factors.
When things don't go as planned, look for the reason in yourself.

@yqf0215 I feel that the OP's EQ is really not high. When the father-in-law comes over with a lot of food, if you are dissatisfied, suggest going out to eat a few times with the father-in-law and wife during the period, and you pay for it.
At the same time, you need to maintain your gratitude to the father-in-law.
That way, the father-in-law and wife will not have any opinions.

If the father-in-law feels that eating out is a waste of money and you can't stand the food that the father-in-law brought, then secretly take your wife out to eat, and leave the food at home for the father-in-law to eat by himself...
If your income is not high and you can't afford every meal outside, then work overtime, go to the company cafeteria to eat, or work overtime and get some McDonald's or buy a takeout.
The OP's father-in-law wants to change the OP, but the OP is also changing the father-in-law, which is a contradiction.
It is immature for your wife to send your chat history to the group, and it is also immature for the OP to want to change the father-in-law...
For various reasons, the OP does not cook or the conditions do not allow him to cook. Maybe you think the food is unpalatable, but your wife eats it with relish...
It is the stupidest thing to dislike your father-in-law's cooking.

@HUZHUANGZHUANG I don't know when you established this kind of money-centric theory. If you are tall and strong, you won't get sick. The marriages of rich people and celebrities must be harmonious everywhere, is that so?
Your wife is the biggest problem...

chunks.en: OP, you should be asking about a way to handle this. It's very simple. If you don't want a divorce and want the family to continue, there's only one way: 1: A satisfactory outcome. The family can continue. There's a bit of a contradiction, but mainly you need to resolve it. You go and admit your mistake to your wife and your father-in-law. Your father-in-law is sensible and self-reflects, thinking that young people nowadays have a strong sense of boundaries, and says it's okay with a grin. Of course, it's also possible that he'll take an inch, but that probability is very low. 2: Don't admit your mistake, be tough to the end, at most get a divorce. Over time, one of the two parties wakes up and reduces contact. Anyway, all you and your wife are doing is getting on each other's nerves once something happens. Of course, it's also possible that other things, the birth of the next generation, will erase everything over time. 3: You feel ashamed, you want face. Your dad steps in, teaches you a lesson, and also gives your father-in-law a hint. @flowerfly
@ugpu #31 You're right, but his handling of things already shows that he doesn't understand human nature, so I don't even mention it.
The simplest thing is money. Spend money on some gold jewelry for your wife during the New Year, and give your father-in-law and mother-in-law 10,000 yuan for the New Year.
I guarantee they won't say a word.
After all, you can't bite the hand that feeds you.
@daodao Uh, your wife is really... amazing.
Generally, the more low-class a child's background is, the less they understand social interactions, and the less they understand the logic of how society works.
Don't say that the decline of the family for three generations is really not wrong, but I believe your father-in-law teaches P.E.
